metadata.title: CVE-2023-25358 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in WebCore::RenderLayer::addChild in WebKitGTK before 2.36.8 allows attackers to execute code remotely.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-25358` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.38.6-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.38.6-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-5.0 - 2.38.6-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.38.6-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.38.6-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
gir1.2-webkit2-5.0 - 2.38.6-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.38.6-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.38.6-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.38.6-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-5.0-0 - 2.38.6-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.38.6-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.38.6-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
libwebkit2gtk-5.0-0 - 2.38.6-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.38.6-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.38.6-0ubuntu0.22.10.1').
